cropbase.field

class cropbase.field.field.Field(index: int | None = None, img_dict=None, crs=None, geometry=None, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

My design of Field class: The Field class is a field, which can be defined by polygon/multipolygon or raster image, or only by an index.

The public properties of a field is a pandas series, which only contains scalar values.(Now I think)

In the future: Following the writing style of PCSE, soil, crops, site, agricultural management, weather, Status variables, Speed variables

Parameters:

  • index – int, the index of the field

  • img_dict – dict, the dict of RSImg

  • crs – str, the projection of the field

  • geometry – shapely.geometry.Polygon or shapely.geometry.MultiPolygon, the geometry of the field

  • pdseries – pd.Series, the public properties of the field

:name str, the name of the field

static aug_mask(cluster_mask: ndarray, location_df: DataFrame, type: str, value_col_name: str)

Input a cluster_mask and a location_df, then generate a new mask, mapper the location_df to the cluster_mask.

Parameters:

  • cluster_mask – np.ndarray The cluster mask

  • location_df – pd.DataFrame or gpd.GeoDataFrame must contain col_idx, row_idx, value fields

  • type – str, mean or max_point_number

Returns:

np.ndarray The augmented mask, nodata is nan

crs = None
deregister_img(name: str)

deregister a RSImg with name to the field. The RSImg will be removed from the img_dict of the private

Parameters:

name – str The name of the RSImg

static filter_point_value_df(point_df: GeoDataFrame, img)

add col_idx, row_idx to point_df and del point not in field

Parameters:

  • point_df – gpd.GeoDataFrame It must be only contain point geometry

  • img – RSImg

Returns:

gpd.GeoDataFrame

gen_aug_mask(cluster_mask: ndarray, location_df: DataFrame, type='mean')

Input a cluster_mask and a location_df, then generate a new mask, mapper the location_df to the cluster_mask.

Parameters:

  • cluster_mask – np.ndarray The cluster mask

  • location_df – pd.DataFrame or gpd.GeoDataFrame must contain col_idx, row_idx, value fields

  • type – str, mean or max_point_number

Returns:

np.ndarray

geometry = None
get_img(name: str)

get a RSImg with name to the field.

Parameters:

name – str The name of the RSImg

index = None
name = None
public_properties = Series([], dtype: float64)
register_img(img: RSImg, name: str)

register a RSImg with name to the field. The RSImg will be stored in the img_dict of the private property of the field object.

Parameters:

  • img – RSImg

  • name – str The name of the RSImg

set public properties of the field

Parameters:
